channel.title: Comments on: Strange Microsoft Live Password Policy

item.title: By: Micha Roon
item.dc:creator: Micha Roon
item.description: it is mid 2015 and the 16 character limit still exists. This is insane and I will not store my e-mails on this service.
item.content:encoded: it is mid 2015 and the 16 character limit still exists. This is insane and I will not store my e-mails on this service.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/02/19/strange-microsoft-live-password-policy/#comment-3985">Samuel "Otto" Wood</a>.
Yep, I remember when L0phtCrack was released. Cracking NTLM passwords for fun and profit, "making the theoretical possible" :-)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Samuel “Otto” Wood.

Yep, I remember when L0phtCrack was released. Cracking NTLM passwords for fun and profit, “making the theoretical possible” ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Samuel "Otto" Wood
item.dc:creator: Samuel "Otto" Wood
item.description: Could be worse. Old NTLM passwords were limited to 14 characters, and the 2 halves of 7 characters were hashed separately. Cracking them takes seconds if you have the hash.
item.content:encoded: Could be worse. Old NTLM passwords were limited to 14 characters, and the 2 halves of 7 characters were hashed separately. Cracking them takes seconds if you have the hash.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2013/02/19/strange-microsoft-live-password-policy/#comment-3983">utahcon</a>.
Would be even better if they ROT13 it twice ;-)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to utahcon.
